events.name: StackUp TechTalk: Build a RoboAdvisor & Rebalance Your Portfolio with Code
events.description:
This presentation will cover the theory behind and practical implementation of an algorithmic portfolio rebalancer that you can use on the real-world stock market. Workshop will cover a Python implementation (please bring a laptop to follow along), however, a short introduction to Python will be given at the beginning of the presentation for those unfamiliar with the language.
Agenda: 

What is a RoboAdvisor?
Python syntax introduction
Introduction to the Trading API
Simple trading algorithms
Putting it all together
Going above and beyond

Speaker: 
Justin Paulin is a visiting undergraduate researcher from the University of Waterloo currently working at the National University of Singapore. Justin has worked previously as an Innovation Engineer at the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce's FinTech Innovation Lab in Toronto. He has won numerous awards at programming competitions both in Canada and abroad, such as those hosted by Northwestern University and the University of Toronto. Justin's projects have also been featured internationally by media outlets such as PC Magazine, Lifehacker, and CHIP Magazine.
Reserving a Seat:
Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat.

events.name: Singapore Magento User Group Meetup - March 2017
events.description:
Date: Thursday, 23 March 2016 Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Level 22,[masked], Singapore Time: 7:00 - 9:00PM Conference room: 22CF-15 Agenda:  1. Rethink payments by Michael Chong Michael Chong is a Braintree solution engineer based in Singapore. He is responsible for the technical implementation, solutions architecture and relationships with merchants and partners in APAC. Michael was also a technical support  engineer with PayPal previously. He is passionate about technology and believes that payment innovation can help grow digital commerce.  Topic details: How payments help to powers business, improve conversion. Payment solution can help to simplify and help keeping a business more secure and helping it stay competitive. How easy to start enable payment on web and your mobile apps.We'll cover how online payment innovated today and help today and how to enable Braintree and feature support in Magento and integration on Braintree drop-in integration in iOS. 2. Magento SAP integration by Aman Agarwal Aman is a Magento certified developer and having great knowledge in Magento development. His major focus areas are Magento integration with many third party services like SAP, CRM, 3PL etc.Working in Ranosys technologies, he has been worked for Singapore Post(samplestore.com) and Charles and Keith (charleskeith.com) online eCommerce platform for their IT needs and integrations. 



Want to speak or share your experience with community? Send message or comment below. 

Connect with us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/SingaporeMagentoUserGroup/<a href="https://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Magento-User-Group/"></a> Pizza and drink are sponsor by Microsoft Singapore :)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, 018989, Singapore

events.name: Azure UG - IoT Hands On Series 2 / Part 2 - Mar 2017
events.description: The event will have 6 teams to start with The 6 leaders who volunteered in the last session and must complete all pre requisites mentioned in the following document https://1drv.ms/b/s!AovvoQEo8E0woR6MihWw5jHFNqrY (https://1drv.ms/b/s!AovvoQEo8E0woR6MihWw5jHFNqrY) Team 1 - Viacheslav Romanov Team 2 - Mohammad Asif Waquar Team 3 - Krishnan Narayanan Team 4 - Ajit Mohan Team 5 - Arunagiri GT Team 6 - Ashish Mudra Developer Machine Setup For anyone who wants to bring their own Raspeberry Pi Boards please complete the pre-requisites mentioned in https://1drv.ms/b/s!AovvoQEo8E0woR6MihWw5jHFNqrY (https://1drv.ms/b/s!AovvoQEo8E0woR6MihWw5jHFNqrY) Following are the objectives for the first 45 mins to 1 hour and let each team to continue to build a solution until end of the session 1. Review on Part 1 of this Series 2. Perform installation of Windows 10 IoT Core on Raspberry Pi 3 board 3. Configure Visual Studio 2017 4. Configure Azure IoT Hub using Azure Passes 5. Connect Rapsberry Pi devices Azure IoT Hub 6. Connect to User Group GitHub Repository ( https://github.com/mssgug/Azure-IoT-User-Group ) Source Code Repository GitHub Organisation: https://github.com/orgs/mssgug (https://github.com/orgs/mssgug) All Team leaders should have a GitHub user id which will be added to http://www.github.com/orgs/mssgug
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room
